Foundations of Occupational Therapy Prac.Description: Students examine the historical and philosophical foundations that have shaped the profession of occupational therapy, its domain, values, and theories, and the foundations of practice with individuals, groups, and populations. Students explore the value of occupation and the role of occupational therapy in promoting health and wellness.

TechnicalAndDigitalSkills: Proficiency in occupational therapy tools and techniques
Understanding of assessment and evaluation methods
Knowledge of biomechanics and neuroscience in therapy
Application of technology in occupational interventions
Competence in clinical documentation and reporting systems
InterpersonalAndCommunicationSkills: Effective communication with clients and healthcare teams
Building therapeutic relationships with patients
Collaborating in interdisciplinary settings
Educating patients and families on therapy goals
Providing feedback and engaging clients in goal setting
ProblemSolvingAndAnalyticalSkills: Critical thinking in developing therapy plans
Evaluating the outcomes of intervention strategies
OrganizationalAndLeadershipSkills: Leading client care plans and therapy sessions
Managing time effectively in clinical environments
Mentoring and supervising junior therapists
Developing community-based occupational programs
Strategic planning for health and wellness initiatives

Occupations II.Description: Students analyze the domains and dimensions of occupations, occupational performance skills and patterns, and the structures, functions, and processes of the body and body systems. Evaluating the outcomes of intervention strategies

Strategic planning for health and wellness initiatives

Doctoral Capstone.Description: The doctoral capstone project is a 14-week full-time experiential course designed to develop students’ skills role related focus areas. Students implement an individually mentored, increasingly self-directed capstone project as the culminating learning activity of the doctoral program.

Practice Scholar Symposium.Description: The synthesis of knowledge gained throughout the didactic curriculum, service-learning and field experiences, and in-depth scholarly capstone experience and project is demonstrated through the completion and presentation of a scholarly product.
